reviews.review_msg: EASY class. Exams were ridiculously easy. If you understood the material and homework questions, u would have no problem on exams. Lectures were pointless, just look at the textbook examples before attempting weekly homework and ur set.

Bob is a nice guy so it makes it hard to rag on him. But he can not teach. It is nearly impossible to pay attention & you will take nothing away from lecture. But he wants the class to do well and gives the easiest exams you'll ever write. Averages were 75%. I learned everything the night before the exams by doing his practice qsts and got an A+.
Nice prof, knows the material very well but lectures can be a bit dry. Exams are not difficult, just make sure you read the textbook and do the practice questions.

Midterm and final written was fair b/c he lets you know what's on it. MC is tricky, calculation MC was straightforward. Can't teach, but such a great guy! Lectures and text don't help. Chapter questions much more difficult than on exams. Take it with him to get a good grade, but don't expect to learn much. Gestures and speech...absolutely hilarious

Decent prof. Not super engaging, but what do you expect when accounting is the subject? Really nice guy, very laid back and doesn't want you to feel any stress from his class. Multiple choice on midterm + final were both challenging, with the calculation M/C and written parts being pretty straightforward.

The lectures were very dry and hard to follow. Anderson does not do a good job of communicating in a way that keeps the students interested. He tends to be quite repetitive and mumbles a lot of jibberish. One of the worst profs i've ever had. Not recommended.

Really good prof, no surprises on his exam and tell you before hand exactly what is going to be on the exams. Just read ahead and do tutorial questions and sample exam and you will be fine. Very understanding as well. Course load is not heavy and is not difficult nor easy its average.
